doc.name: mobileSetUseAndroidAudioWorkaround
doc.summary: Configures the engine to use a patched version of the Media Player, which avoids the sounds played to be cropped on some devices.
doc.overview: Use the mobileSetUseAndroiAudioWorkaround command to configure whether the engine uses a patched media player. This patched media player delays the internal calls to Android Completion Listener, which can cause the sounds to be cropped when played on some devices.

parameter.name: useAudioWorkaround
parameter.description: Whether the engine uses the patched media player. One of:

option.description: Start using the patched media player

doc.description:
This feature has been added in order to respond to the bug 15134 (http://quality.runrev.com/show_bug.cgi?id=15134) in a better way than a hard-coded list of affected devices, and to give the LiveCoders an easy to use workaround.
Like the acceleratedRendering property, this property is not saved in the stack file.
